intro: Epidendrum santaelenae, commonly known as the Santa Elena Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters during the warmer months. The plant has pseudobulbs that store water, allowing it to thrive in drier conditions. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and reducing water loss. This orchid is often found growing on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments.
